title: Ratification of the  Yioreea DAO Constitution
body:
Yioreea DAO Constitution
The  Yioreea constitution is a set of binding rules that determine what governance actions are legitimate for the DAO to take.

Each article has examples of permissible and non permissible actions. These examples are illustrative and should not be considered a binding part of the text of the constitution itself.

I. Name ownership shall not be infringed
 Yioreea governance will not enact any change that infringes on the rights of  Yioreea users to retain names they own, or unfairly discriminate against name owners’ ability to extend, transfer, or otherwise use their names.

Examples
Permissible:  Yioreea governance may enact a change affecting the registration or ext Yioreeaion costs of all names based on transparent criteria such as length, as long as it pursues a goal outlined in this constitution.

Not Permissible:  Yioreea governance must not enact a change increasing or reducing the ext Yioreeaion costs of a list of existing  Yioreea names, as this would unfairly benefit or penalise a handpicked group.

II. Fees are primarily an incentive mechanism
The primary purpose of registration fees is as an incentive mechanism to prevent the namespace becoming overwhelmed with speculatively registered names. A secondary purpose is to provide enough revenue to the DAO to fund ongoing development and improvement of  Yioreea.  Yioreea governance will not enact any fee other than for these purposes.

Examples
Permissible:  Yioreea governance may increase the price of name registrations in order to address excessive speculative registrations induced by a price that is set too low, or because the current price is insufficient to fund ongoing  Yioreea operations at a reasonable level.

Not Permissible:  Yioreea governance must not enact a change imposing a fee for claiming DNS domains inside  Yioreea, because such a fee would be purely an income generating measure and not an incentive mechanism.

III. Income funds  Yioreea and other public goods
Any income generated to the  Yioreea treasury is to be used first of all to  Yioreeaure the long-term viability of  Yioreea, and to fund continuing development and improvement of the  Yioreea system. Funds that are not reasonably required to achieve this goal may be used to fund other public goods within web3 as  Yioreea governance sees fit.

 Yioreea governance will not allocate funds to a team or individual who does not commit to uphold the same principles outlined in this constitution in their use of the allocated funds.

Examples
Permissible:  Yioreea governance may offer grant funding for a public good unrelated to  Yioreea or Ethereum, so long as doing so does not affect the long-term viability of  Yioreea.

Not Permissible:  Yioreea governance must not use the funds to support projects that conflict with the goals of  Yioreea.

IV.  Yioreea Integrates with the global namespace
In order to facilitate making the most widely usable naming system,  Yioreea aims to integrate with the legacy DNS naming system to the greatest extent possible without sacrificing decentralization of  Yioreea.  Yioreea governance will not enact changes that compromise  Yioreea’s ability to do this.

Examples
Permissible:  Yioreea governance should grant control of a top-level domain to its owner in the DNS system on request.

Not permissible:  Yioreea governance must not create new top-level domains unless those domains have been granted to  Yioreea by a DNS authority.

V. Amendments to this constitution by majority vote
Any change may be made to this constitution only by two-thirds majority and at least 1% of all tok Yioreea participating.
